units.title: Tissue cleaning and crypt isolation
units.text: colon tissue was first sliced open lengthwise and wiped 3–4 times with gauze (Fisher Scientific) to remove waste and mucus. The tissue was then cut into small sections of ~2” × 2” and placed into a 15 cm dish filled with PBS++ (PBS supplemented with 10 mM HEPES (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X GlutaMAX (Thermo Fisher Scientific), 1X Pen-Strep (Thermo Fisher Scientific), and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B (Thermo Fisher Scientific). The epithelium was then minced from tissue segments using scalpels (Fisher Scientific) and collected into 50 mL conical tubes. Minced epithelium was washed 3 times with DMEM++ (Advanced DMEM/F12 (Thermo Fisher Scientific) supplemented with 10 mM HEPES, 1X GlutaMAX, 1X Pen-Strep, and 2.5 μg/mL Amphotericin B), and centrifuged at 4 °C, 500 × g for 3 min between each wash.
units.rationale: This is a step-by-step procedure for cleaning colon tissue and isolating crypts for organoid generation.

units.title: EDTA digestion for crypt release
units.text: After the final wash, tissue was resuspended in 25 mL of 2.5 mM EDTA in PBS and placed in an end-over-end rotator at 37 °C until crypts were visible, around 12 min.
units.rationale: This describes a specific, time-controlled enzymatic digestion step to release crypts from tissue.

units.title: Crypt filtration and centrifugation
units.text: Following digestion, the EDTA digestion solution was topped up with 20 mL of DMEM++, filtered through sterile gauze, and centrifuged for 3 min at 4 °C, 500 × g. The pellet was then resuspended in 10 mL PBS+++, filtered through a 100 µm cell strainer, and centrifuged for 3 min at 4 °C, 500.
units.rationale: This outlines precise filtration and centrifugation steps to purify crypts after digestion.

units.title: Organoid plating in Matrigel
units.text: The tissue was then ready for plating in Matrigel (Corning) by resuspending in cold Matrigel and plating into 30 μL Matrigel droplets, at a density of 30–50 crypts per droplet. Once Matrigel had solidified for 30 min at 37 °C, crypts were fed with organoid growth media.
units.rationale: This is a critical procedural step for initiating organoid culture with specific Matrigel handling instructions.

units.title: Organoid media change protocol
units.text: On the day after seeding, media was removed and changed to growth media without Y-27632. On day 3 after seeding, media was removed and organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12. After washing, media was replaced with organoid media without EGF to promote differentiation. Media was changed every 1–2 days, and cultures were maintained in the plates for up to 10 days before collection.
units.rationale: This provides a clear timeline and action steps for media changes during organoid differentiation.

units.title: Organoid passaging with EDTA and Trypsin
units.text: To passage, organoids were mechanically dislodged from Cultrex domes using a P1000 pipette tip and resuspended in cold 10 mM EDTA with 10 µM Y-27632 (STEMCELL Technologies) in a 15 mL conical tube. The tube containing organoids was then placed on an end-over-end rotator at 4 °C for 30 min and then centrifuged for 5 min at 500 ×g, 4 °C. Organoids were then resuspended in 1X Trypsin (Fisher Scientific) and placed in an end-over-end rotator for 6 min at 37 °C. Following dissociation, Trypsin was neutralized with DMEM containing 10% FBS, and organoids were centrifuged for 5 min at 500 × g, 4 °C.
units.rationale: This is a detailed, actionable protocol for organoid dissociation and passaging with specific reagents and timing.

units.title: Microwell plate preparation for organoid seeding
units.text: Prior to organoid seeding, storage buffer was aspirated from each well and 150 µL of Advanced DMEM/F12 was added through the pipetting port. The plate was placed in the tissue culture incubator for at least 30 min.
units.rationale: This describes a preparatory step for microwell plate use, essential for reproducible organoid seeding.

units.title: Organoid dissociation for microwell seeding
units.text: Organoids that had been maintained in Cultrex domes for at least 5 days after passaging were removed from the ECM following the passaging protocol as above, but dissociated for 12 min in Trypsin rather than 6, or until organoids were largely single cells. Trypsin was neutralized and organoids were washed as in the passaging protocol.
units.rationale: This specifies a modified dissociation protocol tailored for microwell plate seeding, with critical timing adjustment.

units.title: Injury model induction with DSS
units.text: For DSS treatment, DSS (MP Biomedicals) was dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide), and added to organoid wells overnight for 16 h, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: This is a precise, time-controlled protocol for inducing epithelial injury using DSS in organoids.

units.title: Cytomix treatment protocol
units.text: For cytomix treatment, human recombinant TNFɑ (R&D Systems), IFNɣ (R&D systems), and IL-1β (PeproTech) were dissolved in organoid media (without EGF or Nicotinamide) for 8 hours, after which organoids were washed twice with Advanced DMEM/F12 and then replaced with organoid media.
units.rationale: This provides exact reagent concentrations, exposure time, and washing steps for cytokine-induced injury.
